website_summaries.verdict: With fast performance, good photos, and an excellent feature-to-price ratio, the Nikon Coolpix S8100 is a compact megazoom worth considering.
pros: 10x zoom in an attractive compact body
cons: Soft photos on either side of ISO 200
white balance is a little off
no manual or semimanual shooting modes

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within 5 month of little use.
customer_reviews.text: First Nikon product purchased. Stopped working within 5 month. Shipping it to Nikon under warranty and they wanted me to cover the repairs because they think it was dropped. I barely used it and was stored in a soft case. I'm OCD and take care of everything I own as carefully as possible. It's been sitting on my shelf for over 3 years now. No use of it. Would not buy any Nikon product again. Ended up purchasing Sony NEX5 and love it. Traveled with it to Siberia and used it at -70 degree temp and it worked unbelievably great.
customer_reviews.author: Pasha

customer_reviews.title: This is a reliable camera that takes good pictures. Sure it is a little dated by ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a reliable camera that takes good pictures. Sure it is a little dated by current standards but still we are reaching the point where how much clearer and sharper do you really need? For most average users this camera takes better quality pictures than you'll ever need. Nikon is well known to make great cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Fits what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to replace my Olympus DSLR. I no longer really needed the Olympus as my fiance had an arguably better Canon 60D. I wasn't thrilled with being camera-less myself though so I went for a more pocketable point and shoot. It's been a nice camera and does a serviceable job. It keeps a charge and takes pretty good pictures. The only downside is on full auto it still requires tweaking the exposure compensation to get the best picture. If you want a purely auto hands off point and shoot that takes great pictures this might not be the camera for you, but if you don't mind tweaking things here and there it's a great little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Sprigler

customer_reviews.title: Talk about Cool . . . pix . . .
customer_reviews.text: The time spent researching which camera to buy was well worth it, and for a relatively small digital camera, you just can't do any better - this camera is just great. I especially like the features of being able to zoom during video, and also being able to snap photos during video as well. This thing takes great photos, regardless of what I throw at it, low light, which thing to focus on, it's automatic mode rarely guesses wrong. The colors are so true that I almost never need to touch them up. The super sharp large monitor is great, too! Definitely would highly recommend for both the amateur and more serious photographer!
customer_reviews.author: Music Lovers

customer_reviews.title: Great Features but flash pictures are HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through over 10 different point and shoot cameras over the past 13 years. I probably bought the first Sony digital camera that recorded on floppy discs for $500 in 1997. It weighed 2 pounds but had a beautiful lens. NOT even 1080 x 800 resolution... This Nikon S8100 is great camera and does great 1080P videos in every aspect except for 2: 1) the FLASH photos shots are almost ALL overexposed and look HORRIBLE. 2) the controls are NOT intuitive and are semi difficult to use I bought this camera in December 2010 and if I had to decide again, I would have / should have bought the more intuitive Cannon.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund W. Cheung

customer_reviews.title: best long-zoom camera. fast response to lock focus
customer_reviews.text: I have been using DLSR for a few years. That says how demanding I am on compact camera too. I have been watching this Nikon S8100 for quite a few months because of its sensor technology, nice lens for compact and macro capability. I bought this S8100 for my family and persuaded a friend to buy one too, after I played with one at BestBuy. It is very fast to lock focus. The scene recognition is pretty smart and the flash photo indoor is very decent quality. Not to mention the HD video capability. For this price, you cannot go wrong unless you are looking for smallest camera regardless of performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tao Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S8100
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a good product for the price. I researched point and shoot cameras and this one seemed to have a lot of good features with a good zoom without being too bulky. Someone recommended not getting more than a 10X zoom on a point and shoot and Nikon is a respected name in cameras. I'm pleased with the performance even though I haven't printed any pictures on photo paper yet. My only complaint so far is that the flash is a little bit of a pain because sometimes it's not automatic, but you get used to it. I would recommend buying this camera at about $250 or so. I also picked up an accessory pack for about $30.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Nikon S8100
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Nikon S3000 which I had bought in July 2010 with the S8100 Dec 2010. This unit is all that I hoped it would be. Sold my S3000 for $50 and glad to be rid of it. This is my fourth digtal camera and third Nikon. Still haven't read the S8100 instruction booklet and getting am awsome results regardless. Some over exposure on closeups in dim light but otherwise one fantastic camera ! No complaints EXCEPT my left finger stopping the flash window from raising now and then. I hope Nikon figures out how to move the flash gizmo elsewhere. All in all a must have / buy compact camera !
customer_reviews.author: BX

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on cameras before purchasing this one. I wanted a DSLR, but didn't have the money for one. We just had a baby and wanted a good camera to capture memories, and we made the right choice! This takes amazing quality photos on auto mode, has lots of settings! The pop up flash hasn't been a problem for me, but I can see how it would irritate some people. The only thing is when we ask other people to take pictures of our family for us, the pop up flash can be hard if people don't know about it/aren't used to it. But otherwise, this camera is great! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jayelleking

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative To My DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera as an alternative to carrying my DSLR. It's perfect for this use. The S8100 is easy to use and the pictures are extraordinary. The photos taken in low light are fantastic; much better than I would have imaged. Designing the pop up flash on the left side of the camera you're the user tends to hold the camera, does not quite make sense to me; however, this was not a deal breaker to purchasing this camera. After a few uses, you'll figure out exactly where you need to place our index finger so it does not infer with the flash.
customer_reviews.author: Auteur

customer_reviews.title: broke after 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as a Christmas present for my husband, meant to be a replacement for a 5 year old Canon Powershot. We have 2 small children and the shutter speed had been an issue on the older camera, so we were hoping this would be an upgrade- unfortunately the speed was not much faster. Also, after 2 months the lens cover stopped opening when we turned on the power rendering the camera unusable. I wish it had broken a month earlier so that I could just return it to Amazon but now we have to deal directly with Nikon, which has been a pain. This camera was way too expensive to have such poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera before gong on a European vacation. It was rated very high by Consumers Guide and I can see why. It is so light and handy to use with the case that your belt slides through. It takes wonderful pictures and it's easy to use. I went with my wife and her brother and his wife. He had one of those SLR Nikon's with all the bells and whistles ( the telephoto lenses etc. a pro model) and not only was mine more convenient, much smaller, lighter and easier to use, it took pictures with the same quality or better than his. Soooo what can I say. But.
customer_reviews.author: Old Model Maker

customer_reviews.title: great portable camera w/ awesome video
customer_reviews.text: I had a larger more professional 7mp camera in the past and found myself leaving it behind when I went places with my wife and kids. This camera does the trick at portability and takes great pictures for a hand-held pocket sized camera. My wife likes the point and shoot without thinking part and I feel it has enough shooting modes and settings that I can take professional quality pictures. The camera starts up fast and is quick from shot to shot. The screen is bright and clear and the movie feature is easy to use and takes awesome video.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good camera that takes good night shots
customer_reviews.text: Good camera and takes night pictures well, which was important to me. One minor flaw is sometimes when I turn the camera for a top to bottom upright shot, it darkens the view and you can't see what you are shooting. But this only happens on rare occasions so I have been very happy with this camera. I even bought one of these for my daughter and she has had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ann D

customer_reviews.title: is best stored in a very clean and slightly oversized case
customer_reviews.text: This is, in some ways, an imperfect camera. It won't last forever, is best stored in a very clean and slightly oversized case, and care should be taken to not touch or allow the zoom casing to be touched by anything. That said, it takes the best low light pictures of any point and shoot camera I've ever seen. I'm now on my second S8100. May it take as many wonderful pictures as the last one did.
customer_reviews.author: Davis Foulger

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy to use. Got this camera the day before we left on vacation. So simple and we got fantastic pictures in San Diego. My husband thought I was getting way to much confidence in the zoom, but my pictures turned out great especially for a point and shoot. My husband who has never been a picture taker even started taking the camera from me. He took great shots. So happy with the low light pictures too. Wish it had a view finder, but most point and shoots don't. So hard to find the perfect camera, but am real happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: grama

customer_reviews.title: Love It !
customer_reviews.text: I am an "average Joe" looking for a camera that takes decent photos on vacation, family parites and what not- this is the 4th camera I've tried in the last 2 years. I've had it for a few days, and so far I'm satisfied with the quality of the photos. I previously had a Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W370 (14.1 mega pixels) and hate it, played around with it for six months and never did get a decent photo with it. I've had the Nikon Coolpix S8100 for 2 days and I'm happy with the quality- I think it's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Mad4Mod

customer_reviews.title: It's lot better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Canon Powershot which slipped in waters and stopped working and had to get a new camera. I love Canon cameras but wanted a change so looked at Sony and Nikon, got a Sony and returned it and then I got this 8100, I was planning to get coolpix 9100 but looking at cost and being new in the market I wanted to get something that has already there with enough reviews and costs less than newer ones. Except few complains like the location of flash, scene selection etc, this one really impressed me, I have taken pictures indoor and outdoor, pictures are really great, great clarity and zoom is also good. LIKE IT.
customer_reviews.author: KKN

customer_reviews.title: fine little camera
customer_reviews.text: I selected this as a gift for my wife based on size, performance and reputation. It is a great camera for its size, the display is really the selling point, amazing. Works like a charm. In a related but not the camera's fault note, the case sponsored and highlighted with this camera at the time of purchase is just about .1" too small. The camera does fit, but only by very careful and exacting placement. I fail to see why it is so hard to offer the correct case.
customer_reviews.author: Terry McCammon

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, except for ergonomics.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this camera overall. Two things I would redesign. The popup flash can easily and inadvertently be held down by the left hand without the user realizing what has happened. This problem could have easily be avoided by eliminating the popup feature. Second, the battery compartment lid seems very cheap and has a awkward latch. Beware the free Kingston 4GB flash card offered by some merchants. That brand is not approved by Nikon for use in this camera according to their customer service representative and the handbook. Could be a problem if warranty issues arise. All-in-all, would not hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: jroybean

customer_reviews.title: Coopix s8100
customer_reviews.text: I'm definitely not a professional photographer, people have however told me I take nice photos and they have gotten nicer since I started using my s8100. it is easy to use & has more features than I will ever use. It has a nice zoom for a camera it's size and will fit in your pocket. Has several burst modes & an awesome macro mode that takes sharp crisp photos with the lens nearly setting on the subject. Constuction and durability seems nice. I'm hoping it will last longer than the last camera (panasonic lumix) that I bought which only lasted a 14 months before it quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Rm

customer_reviews.title: Great for extreme conditions!
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera in my job on job sites in power plants where dust and dirt are everywhere. It takes great pics and lasts about 3 years in this environment, then I buy another one. Usually the lens cover fails from the dirt but this camera is used in extreme conditions--it would last almost forever in ordinary home conditions. I highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable low-light performance
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Reasonable size (fits in pocket). Happy with photos -- noted bright, deep colors. Excellent features for low-light photography -- including a double-exposure mode to capture that great sunset with your foreground subjects illuminated with flash. Basic features are intuitive and easily within reach. With extreme shots, only very minor chromatic aberration and have not noted issues blooming. Time from power-on to first shot is good.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Koehler

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera...Still Too Slow For Sport Photography
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice camera for the price. It is fast, especially in good light. I bought it for photographing my kids sports activities (volleyball and soccer) and I have found it to be too slow for indoor sports like volleyball. It wants to use a flash indoors and by the time the flash goes off, the play is long past. Soccer season is already over, but I imagine I will have more luck there since it is an outdoor sport. I am also playing with turning off the flash at volleyball games to try to speed up the camera shutter speed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Diercks

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, no complaints. As with all cameras, a little practice is needed going through the menu, and testing/experimenting with the settings to get an understanding of how the settings affect the overall look of the picture. Pictures are better than that of a camera phone.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: BEST Digital handy!
customer_reviews.text: Hey, guess what?! the only point and shoot that satisfy your photography! I got this for my road trip, and it's fabulouuuusss! Yep, TRUE.. the HD is so TRUE [used it for almost anything] The built in mic is no good, but with external mic, you'll get an awesome video in HD.. No other point and shoot can top this camera! Get it and you won't be sorry.. Oh, get it from Amazon too bc it's way cheaper! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Christian X

customer_reviews.title: 11 months and it quit...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera 12/10 and now have to send it back to Nikon. While on vacation last month for a family reunion in Cabo San Lucas the darn lens frozen in the "OPEN" position and wouldn't turn off. I'll send it back and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: Yoyo’s mom

customer_reviews.title: good all-around point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Vibration reduction works pretty well. The stock battery runs out roughly after 300 shots. It's worth a spare battery if you expect to go beyond that for the day. HD video works great with 720p. But 1080p looks choppy and floaty (as it can't keep up with the pace of data stream at that limit of hardware strength). For a compact and quick picture capture, it's worth the price. Especially when you see those in the tourist sites with huge dSLRs hung around their necks:)
customer_reviews.author: S7 user

customer_reviews.title: A Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: All the good things that others reviewers mentioned. The video is better than expected. Really easy to use whether taking videos or just pictures. I did hear the click sound when I switched to tracking mode but went away after switching to another scene or auto. The macro is useful for me. Overall, I would recommend it. A suggestion to get a bigger SD card like 32 GB if full HD video is preferred.
customer_reviews.author: Shu

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good camera for the price I paid and the fact it is an old model...
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera to replace our three year old one . Very nice and compact with the easy of use for features but almost all picture were blurry when used on stand or taken by camera in hand. We bought the same brand and one of a lesser model and all was very good must have just have been this one camera out of the bunch .
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little point and shoot camera. It has many features and digital video recording at 1080. Pictures look great on big flat screen TV's. It comes loaded with goodies. And has more than enough settings to capture the image in many differnt lights and you can edit on the camera. Great Value
customer_reviews.author: SupaDeb

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 Don't lend it out.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I am very happy with most aspects of the camera although I haven't had time to thoroughly evaluate it. My friend enjoys the shake reduction which saves her quite a few pictures. Viewfinder image very crisp. Pictures excellent. Only flaw is that I tend to hold the camera with my left fingers on the top of the case, but that prevents the flash from popping up. I had considered a DSLR, but thought that this model would probably do almost anything I wanted. However, I may have to buy another camera anyway as my friend doesn't want to part with the S8100. This is also the reason that I haven't explored all the features of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: alphabear

customer_reviews.title: Good for getting that quick shot
customer_reviews.text: The camera has a very quick start up-to-first shot time. Also, the time between shots is very quick. Both take about a second. The flash does pop up where you normally hold it but if your finger is in the way, it tell you about it and can still take the picture. You just get use to holding the camera slightly differently. It is not a big change and not a deal breaker by any means. Overall, a very good camera.
customer_reviews.author: MikeB

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Nikon camera i bought in the past 6 months. The first was the L810, I didn't like that one because my images were getting scrambled when i used the review function so I was pissed but decided to give Nikon a second chance and bought the S8100. owned this camera for roughly 3 months and now its not working I keep getting a lens error and the camera has never been dropped. Sometimes it comes on and won't even show anything on the screen. Straight garbage i won't buy another Nikon product any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the reviews on this camera, so I purchased the Nikon 8100 for my daughter for x-mas. I gave it to her on the first day of our family vacation so she would have the option of continuing to use her expensive/bulky Canon camera or I would give her 'cash' (and I would keep the camera). Darn...she fell in love with it's size, quality and ease of use. She took the camera to the slopes, snowmobiling and all around town. After a week in Pagosa Springs, she had taken over 150 pictures that we viewed on the tv on our last day of our vacation. Nice camera...great pictures...we all loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: looks nice, works OK
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Nikon S8100 for 3 months. It could be a GREAT camera with the following: variable speed zoom, manual aperatue and manual shutter speed, and a viewfinder for those sunny days. Instead, it is a nice looking but fairly vanilla point and shoot. The zoom is nice. I don't mind the slighly large size. I don't mind the flash position that everyone seems to dislike. The macro is fantastic in camera and movie mode and I would say that plus the zoom are the camera's best features. Come on -- please --somebody build a high quality small format for the days the SLR can't go! Today, I am sending to repair shop - lens will not retract!?!?
customer_reviews.author: dorydan

customer_reviews.title: did not live up to the name
customer_reviews.text: It's has been two years to the month and my camera gave up the ghost. It has not been abused at all; I'm anal about taking care of my electronics. The imagery in the LED screen has gone bad (grainy and off color) where you can no longer see an accurate view of what you want to take a picture of. I am very disappointed to say the least. They only have a one year warrenty.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write a review but my experience needs to be stated. After a few months the flash stopped working, it just wouldn't fire. Its odd that the flash would stop working so early int he camera's life. I sent it to them two months ago for repair and I still have not received it back!!!! I have called them a few times and they are rude and don't even care. I spoke to a supervisor to see if there was anything he could do to help and he was obnoxious. They have been waiting on the flash part from Japan for all this time. Canon would not have treated me this way.
customer_reviews.author: F. Hay

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until the telescoping lens broke.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until the telescoping lens broke. The camera turns on easily and was turned on my pocket several times. It doesn't have a pressure release, so it broke in my pocket. However, I am still able to manual telescope the lens. Pictures are of high quality, but the interface is not well designed.
customer_reviews.author: Weston A Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a non-techie
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mom, who wanted a quality camera that she could handle with ease. She loves the size, the large viewscreen on the back, and how simple it is for her to operate. Takes amazing pictures and my mom can handle getting photos onto her computer and printed readily at Costco. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy O

customer_reviews.title: An excellent versatile point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful little camera. I've used it in a variety of settings (candelit concert in a church, snow, coffehouse) and it invariably produces sharp, crisp images. The camera has a number of built in photo environments (Museum, Night Portrait, Snow, Food, etc), but the Auto mode seems to work pretty well in most situations.
customer_reviews.author: William Lee Bynum

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of NIKON. I bought Coolpix 6400 several years ago. So S8100 doesn't make me disappointed. Less professional than 6400 but definately higher than general camera, plus it improves the speed of focus which really annoyed me at earlier camera. It's commerical price is 299, but really great deal in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to spend some time with the instructions.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera. There are so many features, it can be difficult to figure out the one you want to use on the fly. The unit is small, compact, light, with a great picture quality. I have been using my new camera to photograph action scenes of my new invention, The FlashBak Rear bike light. Sample photos will soon be available on our web site: [...] This camera is a quality product and I bought it despite, or because of the Ashton Kutcher commercials(I'm not too sure).
customer_reviews.author: Austinnewbee

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: This Nikon s8100 was a replacement for an old pocket camera and we are very pleased with it. Great HD videos and zoom photos. The only minor drawback is the flash pops up from the top left side of the camera where I tend to place my left index finger, which has prevented the flash from fully deploying. Still, a great camera at a great price. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: mannyandlily

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S8100
customer_reviews.text: I spent a considerable amount of time looking for a camera that I needed for a special use. After going to 4 stores, comparing cameras and prices, I decided to go on Amazon. The price was much lower than the retail stores. More importantly, the camera suits my needs perfectly, takes great pictures. The flash works beautifully, the red eye feature is good, the pictures are very sharp and clear. I received my Nikon quickly, well packaged and exactly as advertised. Very satisfied with the camera and the transaction with Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: frannyv

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: I have few digital cameras, but this one is the best ever. It is very easy to use and very compact with professional quality pictures. I love it, LOVE IT. I bought it very cheap from AMAZON.COM. I have 16 months old son who i took the best pictures of him with this incredible camera. I recommend this camera for everybody who wants to capture best pictures.
customer_reviews.author: fikir

customer_reviews.title: Best point-and-shoot ever!
customer_reviews.text: I had never seen a point-and-shoot that took such clear, quality pictures until I found this one. I bought one several years ago, and liked it so much I just got another one to replace it. I used to carry around a DSLR, until I fell in love with this smaller camera. The video quality surprised me, too, with clear image and life-like sound. I've even used some video footage from this camera in several of my video productions. As a former photography studio owner, I can recommend this with confidence. Well done, Nikon!
customer_reviews.author: TaraPaypir

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love my new camera! It is fast and has an amazing zoom. I got some great shots of my daughter jumping off a rock at the beach and I actual caught it while she was in the air! I have never spent more than $150 on a camera so this is pretty special and I would say, its worth the money. Kate
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Best camera out there for the money!
customer_reviews.text: With the S8200 now being sold, we purchased the S8100 for $204 shipped...what a deal! This camera has all the features you look for in a compact camera, and the 10X zoom is great. The pictures came out very clear; I was impressed. The video looks great, but haven't watched them on the TV yet. The main purpose is the camera, so the video is just a bonus anyways. As stated, you will not be able to beat this camera for the price. Get one now before they are all gone!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall O.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Excellent and clear zoom
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Excellent and clear zoom, GREAT low light performance. The zoom makes audible noises during video, but the slow-mo option makes that up for me. Invest in a fast SD card and it has very little delay between shots. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel H.

customer_reviews.title: fun new camera
customer_reviews.text: really like this camera. Takes great night time pics, people and xmas lights. Really good party pics. haven't used it for panoramic views but will update. Only drawback is the pop up flash. what were they thinking? I'm sure I'll get used to this but it is inconvenient and annoying. haven't tried the video part.
customer_reviews.author: K. B. O.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great for me. I have benign familial trembling and this camera freezes the pic and gives me a great picture when other cameras gave me fuzzie pictures because of my tremors.
customer_reviews.author: cbsnurse

customer_reviews.title: Nikon S8100
customer_reviews.text: Handy little camera with lots of quality features. Cons: Flash unit pops up out of an inconvenient location, no manual settings option, flimsy mini-HDMI cover. Pros: Great picture quality, multiple auto-settings, strong flash, handy shirt pocket size, under $200.00.
customer_reviews.author: rooster6758

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix rocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 other digital cameras. I researched this model before buying it. I could only afford a used one. This little camera is leap years ahead of my others. I am extremely happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: lily127

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it a couple days but I love it. Easy to work. I've taken several videos with it and it was simple to do. It shipped fast. Only thing I'm not to happy about it the cover for where you plug in the cord for charging. It seems kind of flimsy and probably will not last.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn15790

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 is totally cool
customer_reviews.text: Great features and amazing flexibility. HD makes it a step above many others along with facial recognition and low light/nighttime controls. 10X zoom is wonderful. No suggestions for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Deadwood

customer_reviews.title: Broke and did not last long
customer_reviews.text: I think this is an excellent camera, but after only having it only for a few months it broke on the 5th day of our cruise - not good. They sent a replacement, and overall it's an excellent camra, and now after having it for about two years, it's broken again and has a light clicking sound, and can't take video with the zoom feature because it shakes too much.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long
customer_reviews.text: This was an ok camera while it lasted, but 6 months after the warrantee expired the lens stopped focusing. While it worked it did a reasonably good job of taking photos, some really nice ones. The menu system was slow to use and the macro never seemed to work.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: My first Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had my eye on Nikon's Compact Digital Cameras for a couple of years. Reviewing several cameras on Nikon's website, testing them at stores, checking prices, etc. Even though I was looking for a more compact camera; the Nikon Coolpix S8100 caught my eye because of its features and size. I even checked other sites, but nobody beat it at the time, not even after two months. I am very please with the product, and Amazon's service and deal.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: great pics, great HD video
customer_reviews.text: 5 years old now, use nearly every week for something, great pics, great HD video, very well made camera.
customer_reviews.author: Stan R.

customer_reviews.title: Camera was defective
customer_reviews.text: Camera was defective did not work. sent it back waiting for refund.
customer_reviews.author: George E Turner

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Much easier to use than my old film-version Nikon of technology from the ancient past. The video that can be taken with this camera is amazingly good, as well as the still photos. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce in Texas

customer_reviews.title: sharp and very good colored images
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nikon Coolpix S8100, because the first one was damaged. The pictures taken by this camera have clear, sharp and very good colored images, like those taken by more expensive ones. Must due to the lenses. Much better than the later models in the same series. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia T

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Camera!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are very pleased with this compact camera. It takes excellent photos, easy to use, great zoom, and fast. It compliments my Nikon D5000 nicely. Exactly what we were looking for in a reasonably priced high quality compact camera. FlyBoy Seal of Approval
customer_reviews.author: FlyBoy

customer_reviews.title: Nikon does it again.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Great camera right out of the box. Great zoom lens. Great pictures. Great for vacation and trips. Good options in manual mode. Nice camera to bring if you don't want to lug your SLR around. Con: Hard to get around in manual mode and find what you want. Seems a bit slow at times for action shooting. But remember;it's not a SLR.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel F. Favata

customer_reviews.title: Great pics
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nikon 8100. The first one lasted about a year. The photo quality is great. The zoom is great. I like the easy of using the various features. Even though my first one quit working (card read error) I decided although not as durable as I would like, I could not find anything a liked more. Hope this one lasts a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: joevinnie

customer_reviews.title: Lens Error Strikes Again
customer_reviews.text: I really love the size, feel and capabilities - excellent zoom and functions, but after only about 7 weeks of use, this camera lens locked and I got the "lens error" message - while on the second day of my vacation in Austria. Sent to Nikon and I'm still waiting after a month in their shop. In the meantime, I've missed having the camera for my family vacation - ugh! I suspect they have a backlog on the the part as this appears to be a common problem. Really want to like Nikon but not sure I can buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Hull

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera, I have wanted to buy this camera for some time (my son has one), finally it came down to my price range. Great HD movies, great pictures even at the lower pixels. and does very well in low light
customer_reviews.author: F. W. Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Top Camera
customer_reviews.text: My wife enjoys taking videos when we travel. The Nikon Coolpix S8000 we have is a bit limited for that use. We got the S8100, and she now gets amazing videos, with which we both are pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Earle Williams

customer_reviews.title: FOOL PROOF
customer_reviews.text: the only thing i can say about my new s8100 is wow. it is very easy to use. a little small for a mans hands but i'm adjusting. i take many pics of airplanes in flight and the zoom is amazing. i love it after using 35mm yashica manual for the last 40 years.
customer_reviews.author: waddy

customer_reviews.title: good camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: very easy to start using. battery already had some charge in it. didn't have to do a thing to take my first pictures. so far i've only used it for family photos, so no opportunity to use some of the features for landscape photos (my reason for getting the 10x zoom). only complaint is the pop up flash, i have a tendancy to rest my balancing fingers over it, and have had to retake several photos due to no flash. other than that, pretty compact and excellent quality. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: nat

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with this camera. It takes pictures without a delay, which was my wife's biggest complaint about our old one. The pictures are extremely sharp and the videos are great. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: T. Triol

customer_reviews.title: My Camera
customer_reviews.text: After a recommendation from my Dad, who is a professional photgrapher, I picked this one. I shopped for a couple of months to make sure it was THE ONE! Love this camera! The only thing I have had to get used to is not putting my finger where the flash is at. It didn't take long for me to remember, and it was game on! I took a leftover LCD screen cover for my cell phone, cut it, and placed it on the LCD screen to make cleaning it easier without worrying about scratching it. Well worth the investment. And my Dad likes it too!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Long

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up well at all!
customer_reviews.text: Took great pics when it works. After just a couple months, the lens began to bind up when extending. I would have to remove and then replace the battery to get it reset. It finally just quit working. I will replace it with Canon. It's really too bad because it takes great pics but failed prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: Ron C

customer_reviews.title: Nikon S8100
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera as a refurbished item at a really good price. Am totally happy with it. Was just out in Colorado for 2 weeks and took lots of pictures. They all came out superb. Easy to set up and use. Very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had problem this year and it was resolved quickly through the extra warranty plan we had purchased.
customer_reviews.author: PCR Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Finally! After buying and returning 7 cameras, this is IT!
customer_reviews.text: My wife is so picky I've been through 7 cameras, from a large DSLR (too complicated and sometimes slow), to superzooms (still too bulky and slow) to ultracompacts (bad low light photo quality). This is the one we're KEEPING! Great photo and video quality, great response time, and great low light photos! And the picture quality is pristine. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: quadmaster

customer_reviews.title: the instruction sheet is in very fine print
customer_reviews.text: i have not got around to reading the instructions, the fine print is hard to see,i have a best friend that has one so will get him to get me started
customer_reviews.author: harold m.

customer_reviews.title: electrobrand lies, gives 0 custromer service, they just don't care
customer_reviews.text: i suppose the camera is ok, don't know, never got it the purchase was made on june 13 th, paid 10 usd to have on time, and arrived at the hotel I was staying 5 days later, on the 26 of june at electrobrand they lied to me, and told me if erase my review they would send anther one, wich never happend never buy with them, be careful, they lie, don't care for the customer, and took my money
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Fernandez de C L

customer_reviews.title: Coolpix is a cool camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for about a month; it is really nice. I like the (1) sharpness of the pictures (2) camera helps me to know when I have a good shot -- blue indicator around the person's face (3) camera indicating when someone may have blinked so that I can retake the picture (4) camera decides when the flash is needed. Thanks for all the favorable reviews of this camera; that is what conviced me to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: New Nikon user

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Makes great pictures and it is easy to use. I have it from 3 years and I still love it! Great product. The battery is fine, long life,but if you like to make a looot of pictures, like 200-300 a day may be you should order another battery in case. This is what I did and I never had problems!
customer_reviews.author: Iglika Georgieva

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am looking for a compact digital camera for a long time. I am using DSLR but sometimes I really need a small and talented compact camera. I compare the Canon and sony cameras with S8100 and I can say that this is a clean win for Nikon. It has a good optic, nice 10x zoom, very sharp and detailed LCD, VR, wide angle lens and a perfect look. Also it has a very quality and good looking finish. I highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmet Cetintas

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice compact camera
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera because the picture quality was very good. Firstly I returned this camera and ordered for Nikon P100 because in almost same price range I was getting the 26x zoom and more,But I found the picture quality is more sharp in this and I am going to get this camera back again. I am not a advance photographer and for my limited range of photography it has a good quality picture. It doesn't have manual mode but auto and scene mode are really nice. 10x zoom is good and able to produce nice image.
customer_reviews.author: sumit kumar gupta

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This little camera is simple, easy to use and take great pictures. No unnecessary gadgets just point and shoot. Took this to Alaska and it worked like a charm. Both landscape and inside were great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ivins

customer_reviews.title: $149 best buy black friday special
customer_reviews.text: Nov 25, 2011 Best Buy special is $149, can return until end of Dec. This is a pretty good deal, but still much more than various other 12mp point and shoots with 4x zoom and 720 video from $49-90.
customer_reviews.author: Tom100

customer_reviews.title: Product seems to be as described. However the images ...
customer_reviews.text: Product seems to be as described. However the images are not as sharp as my previous camera. We re trying to diagnose it now.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight E. Deal and Mary Deal

customer_reviews.title: Good Photo Quality
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes very nice photos. The gold color is perfect. Charge lasts a long time. The only thing I absolutely do not like is the flash. The placement is very awkward. I always end up placing my finger on top it. Otherwise, it's a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: S8100 Coolpix
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera a few months ago. Was shipped fast and I loved it at first, great zoom and very clear pictures. I went on vacation about about 15 days later I was using the camera and suddenly the lens become stuck and the screen stated a lens error. Nothing became stuck in the lens but because of such a large zoom something in the lens acually broke. I called nikon and lets just say my camera was not fixed.
customer_reviews.author: rlg1991

customer_reviews.title: Nikon s8100
customer_reviews.text: After one year of trying to resolve the sepia color of pictures, specially macro. I have given up. My unit seems to need the perfect lighting to produce a decent picture. Nikon fix is "reset all", it has not worked yet.
customer_reviews.author: zoppo

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money-close ups with flash it too much some times
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy the 8100, we had an 8000 and it was great also. Great pictures and easy to use. Auto settings work well. Will make good pictures in low light situations and in total darkness if necessary. In real estate we make pictures in vacant houses with no power and this is a great asset. On very close up shots, we have experienced almost too much light. Flash pop up is new but getting use to it. We have 2 yr old Grandson who enjoys having his picture made as much an any 2 yr old. It grabs a quick picture when we need it.
customer_reviews.author: anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works nice and takes video also. Easy to use. easy to upload and print photos. I added a memory card and can switch from internal to external memory depending on my memory needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amdar

customer_reviews.title: Great photos
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great photos. The only problem that has occurred over time is that the icons on the dial have worn off and it is a trick to know where the various setting are.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce E. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: The only place I could find this camera was on Amazon. Wanted RED, who doesn't??? Found it here and love, love, love this camera. Love Nikon! Convenient, easy to carry, good photos. Works for a basic need.
customer_reviews.author: ao

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I did a lot of research before I bought it. It was highly rated and true to the reviews. Great quality and the pictures are clear and it has a fast shutter speed to catch my 18mo old son. Only draw back is its not water proof so now I have to get another after dropping it in the ocean. lol. My fault but I will be getting another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We didn't like this camera as much as our previous Sony
customer_reviews.text: We didn't like this camera as much as our previous Sony. Kept it for a while, then it stopped working on one of our trips. When we returned, we bought another Sony for much clearer pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hardwick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for someone. Did not use myself
customer_reviews.author: jersey guy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Overall image quality is not that great. I was hoping that this camera would produce better than average low light photos. It does not. They are frequently fuzzy and a bit out of focus. Although the camera is quicker than most point and shoots, the flash slows it down. The flash also seems too bright, often over exposing the nearest object in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: rhm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Travel Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera before going on an 11-day cruise with my husband. It was perfect! It's small enough to fit in my purse or my husband's pockets, the resolution is great for pictures and video, and it has just enough zoom. We bought an extra battery, just in case we would need a spare, but we never did. The flash can be a little bit of a pain until you get used to it, but it wasn't a big deal for us. I highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Windi.G

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera. Pop up Flash is Designed in Wrong Place
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, compact camera. The pictures turn our relatively clear. The video works well, although it has trouble focusing at times. The flash popup design is flawed, however. The flash pop up is right where you naturally place your finger to take a shot. I eventually got used to it, but every time I had someone else take a photo, inevitably their finger would inhibit the flash from popping up.
customer_reviews.author: R. Feenstra

product_meta.title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
product_meta.description:
Color:RedFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 High speed operation, exceptional low light performance, excellent image quality and sophisticated features mark the 12.1-megapixel Coolpix S8100, with advanced CMOS sensor technologies. The optical 10x Zoom-Nikkor ED glass lens covers 30-300mm, and the camera's speedy start-up, fast autofocus, quick shutter release, superior low light performance and high-speed continuous shooting (capture 5 shots in one second) to ensure capture of memorable moments. 



The versatile Coolpix S8100 offers Optical VR Image Stabilization, high ISO sensitivity up to 3200, a new flash control system, full HD 1080p movie recording with stereo sound and a 3- inch Ultra-High Resolution (921,000-dot) Clear Color Display for bright, sharp image viewing and sharing. 

Nikon Coolpix S8100 Highlights 

Superior Image Quality  * 12.1 -megapixel CMOS sensor for high speed operation and exceptional low-light performance. 
 * 10x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom-Nikkor ED Glass Lens. Versatile 30-300mm lens ranges wide to capture landscapes, zooms in to get close to the action. In the Nikkor tradition of precision optics, the high-quality ED glass lens delivers superb color and razor-sharp results. 
 * 4-way VR Image Stabilization System 
 * Optical VR Image Stabilization by lens shift minimizes the effects of camera shake. 
 * Motion Detection automatically detects moving subjects and adjusts shutter speed and ISO to compensate for camera shake and subject movement. 
 * High ISO up to 3200 for optimum results when shooting in low light or photographing fast-moving subjects. 
 * Nikon's Best Shot Selector (BSS) automatically takes up to ten shots while the shutter is pressed, then selects and saves the sharpest image. 
 * EXPEED C2 continues to expand the possibilities of photography with improved levels of image quality, fine detail and processing speed. Custom-optimized for each Coolpix model, Nikon's renowned digital image processing engine ensures outstanding images. 

Advanced Functions  * 3-inch Ultra-High Resolution (921,000-dot) Clear Color Display for still images and movies that come alive with rich detail and improved contrast. The large LCD's wide viewing angle and antiglare coating make it easy to compose, view and share pictures. 
 * Advanced low light shooting capability. 
 * Shoot still images even while recording HD Movie. Creative Control 
 * Mode Dial for quick setting of key functions. 
 * ISO can be set as high as 3200. 
 * In-camera editing functions include Quick Retouch, and DLighting. 
 * Creative Slider allows adjustment of brightness, saturation and color. 

HD Movie Recording  * Full HD (1080p) Movie with Stereo and HDMI Output, optical Zoom control and stereo sound recording. HDMI output allows easy incamera playback or convenient playback on HD-TV or computer. In-camera movie editing function also available. One-Touch record button for instant Movie recording. 

High Speed Performance  * Ultra-fast start-up, autofocus and shooting. 
 * High Speed Shooting capture 5 shots in one second at full resolution. 
 * Sport Continuous Shooting to capture fast action (reduced image size) 
 * Shoot Slow Motion Movies up to 240 fps by selecting HS Movie mode (reduced image size) 
 * Subject Tracking automatically tracks a moving subject to ensure sharp focus. 

Convenient Features  * Smart Portrait System 
 * Smile Timer automatically releases the shutter when your subject smiles. 
 * In-Camera Red-Eye Fix automatically corrects most instances of red-eye as you shoot. You may never see red-eye again. 
 * Face-Priority AF. Nikon's face-finding technology automatically detects up to 12 faces. 
 * Skin Softening smoothes skin tones at three different levels for optimal portraits; can be applied while shooting or during playback. 
 * Blink Warning alerts you if a subject has blinked. 
 * 17 Scene modes including Scene Auto Selector 
 * Scene Auto Selector automatically recognizes the scene you're shooting and selects the most appropriate scene mode; offers six scene modes plus auto. 
 * Macro shooting as close as 0.4 inches. 
 * 220 still shots (approx.) with supplied EN-EL12 Li-ion rechargeable battery.
feature_bullets: 12.1-megapixel CMOS sensor for high-speed operation and low-light performance
10x wide-angle optical Zoom-Nikkor ED glass lens
Full HD (1080p) Movie with Stereo and HDMI Output
Capture images and video to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars444 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
